comments:
I was rather quickly editing some small java files, performing the following
sequence of operations:
- doubleclick .java file in Package Explorer
- make a small change (paste)
- Ctrl + S
- Click on Editor close box

Suddenly, my (single) WorkbenchWindow disappeared and a dialog came up, saying
that there were problems saving the workbench. Only choice was "OK", which shut
down eclipse altogether. I restarted eclipse, everything looked fine.
Made an edit and saved. Eclipse automatically rebuilt all my source projects.
Could not reproduce the error afterwards.

I think, my last command before crash was Ctrl+S, but I cannot confirm on oath.

Incremental build is switched on.

Eclipse Platform

Version: 2.0
Build id: 200210091501
The following entries were logged:

Moving to Platform UI for further investigation. The stack track seems to 
support the description that the workbench window closed while Save/autobuild 
has been active.
Can not recreate. Please reopen if this happens again
